description: Borrowed from Latin garrulus (“talkative”), from the verb garriō (“I chatter”).

adjectives.description: garrulous (comparative more garrulous, superlative most garrulous)

examples: Synonyms: chatty, talkative, longiloquence, long-winded, loquacious, tonguey, voluble; see also Thesaurus:talkative

entries.meaning: (of something written or performed) Excessively wordy and rambling.
examples: Synonyms: bombastic, rambling, wordy; see also Thesaurus:verbose
